description:
Global Sponsorships & Exhibits Manager

About BNI

Established in 1985, BNI is the world’s largest business referral network. With over 300,000 small-to medium-size business members in nearly 11,000 chapters across 76+ countries, we are a global company with local footprints. Our proven approach provides members with a structured, positive, and professional referral program that enables them to sharpen their business skills, develop meaningful, long-term relationships, and experience business growth.

Visit BNI.com to learn how BNI has impacted the lives of our members and how it can help you achieve your business goals.

Position Summary:
BNI is looking for an experienced Global Sponsorships & Exhibits Manager to join its Global Events team. This position is responsible for selling and managing exhibits and sponsorships for BNI Global Events, including the annual Global Convention and US National Conference. This position is part of the Global Events team responsible for all activities related to the strategic planning and execution of key global events for the organization. This role must provide excellent customer service while driving sales through event revenue opportunities. As part of a dynamic team, this position is responsible for revenue goals on existing opportunities, as well as new sales opportunities that may be identified.

The candidate will serve as an important ambassador and representative of BNI and will be expected to collaborate with internal stakeholders to identify business development opportunities that lead to long-standing partnerships.

The role is a key pillar to the success of global events, requiring a problem-solver who focuses on possibilities rather than limitations, and employs a positive, collaborative approach. The candidate must be sales-oriented and skilled at identifying and engaging contacts that are existing partners, in addition to generating a robust pipeline of qualified new prospects for events. In addition to growing sales through sponsorships and exhibits, this role requires attention to detail, organization and the ability to execute on promises made to partners.

About the role:

Sales
• In consultation with Director, Global Events, set and achieve revenue goals for BNI Global Events sponsorship and exhibit sales.
• Prepare promotional materials such as a prospectus, sales website/platform, and media kit.
• Maintain and update current sales opportunities on BNI Event webpages.
• Research, develop and cultivate a list of potential exhibitors and sponsors.
• Identify and develop retention and growth strategies with existing partners.
• Share best practices and develop strategies that maximize event partnership revenue potential.
• Maintain a robust new business pipeline of partnership prospects
• Manage reports and prospect development

Operations and Execution
• Work with all departments to become knowledgeable on all BNI global events in order to effectively and persuasively target the value proposition of our offerings to the right prospective buyer profile.
• Serve as first point of contact for inbound inquiries related to exhibits, sponsorships and revenue generating opportunities for global events.
• Create and maintain impeccable customer relationships, including identifying customer needs and responding creatively, listening to information, asking questions, and applying knowledge to determine solutions.
• Support exhibitors and sponsors with customer service inquiries and execution of benefits in the agreement, welcome letters, deadline reminders, forms collection, invoicing and payment collection, etc., ensuring excellent customer service, quality control, and consistency of experience, including management email inboxes and WhatsApp groups.
• Maintain accurate records and sales activity
• Create and manage the exhibit show process and floor plan development, exhibit operations, vendor relationships, service kit development, registration, VIP management, and selection and testing of an exhibit sales platform.
• Maintain knowledge of convention timelines and year-round deliverable deadlines. Ensure contracted deliverables are met by all associated parties.
• Represent BNI at Global Convention, US Conference, and other events as needed.
• Assist at all exhibits events to deliver customer service and retain or increase event investment moving forward. Maintain a professional demeanor whenever representing BNI internally or externally.
• Prepare post-event and year-end reports detailing results and achievement of established exhibit and sponsorship revenue goals. Communicate overall results through regular dashboards.
• Maintain working knowledge of current sponsorship and exhibit sales trends for events. Work with appropriate staff to evaluate current offerings, ensuring continual improvement and quality customer service.
• Strategize, develop, manage and assign floor plan
• Create and manage the exhibition production and timeline
• With the Director of Global Events, implement expo-floor activities including social functions and traffic-builders
• Create show specs for electrical, audio visual and tradeshow F&B through various vendors
• Review and reconcile vendor invoices; tracking and collecting accounts receivable
• Manage/Oversee client tradeshow management services and logistics
• Provide tradeshow support (for example, shipping management of assets and supplies, internal communication support with team supporting each tradeshow, monitoring tradeshow communications and deadlines, booth planning and management)
• Establish best practices, templates, and standard operating procedures for effective exhibit and sponsorship management.
• Provide execution support for global events as needed.

Education, Knowledge, Skills & Experience:
• The ideal candidate brings a combination of initiative, experience, and long-term strategic thinking to the role.
• Strong background in sales, preferably in event, exhibits and sponsorship sales
• Demonstrated track record in business development and sales, generating strategic partnerships and executing partnership agreements.
• Exceptional verbal and written communications skills; a succinct, articulate, communicator.
• Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline; or equivalent work experience.

We are a company that focuses on Building Relationships. With that, we are only hiring for in-person opportunities based in our existing offices. 

  

This is a full-time, exempt paid position based in the office at our headquarters in Charlotte, NC. This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. 

 

BNI’s wonderful culture based on Givers Gain® is lived out every day by our team and over 300,000 members globally. 

  

Learn more at BNI.com 

  

An equal opportunity employer.
